I was microdosing before I was on medication, but I would have a nice litttle contained and managed trip and for weeks after everything was so much more enjoyable. I learned to appreciate life and the beauty within everything that is life. Around the 4-8 week span is when I feel the need to medicate and I do another dose. It puts things into perspective for me. It helps me understand myself and the world I live in. I only eat mushrooms, I love them, and I respect them. Theyre better medicine for me than the pills I‚Äôm on to regulate myself.

The first few times I used a tampon it was really painful. I started my period when I was ten so I had zero knowledge on anatomy or anything. I later learned I just wasn‚Äôt inserting it correctly. Even now 13 years later I still feel a bit uncomfortable when I insert them. 
I normally insert mine sitting on a toilet and I lift a leg up and angle it a bit upwards towards my back. At about a 30 degree angle. After I use the plunger thing I always use a finger to give it an extra push in case I didn‚Äôt get it in all the way.  Seems to help in the comfort aspect.

My best advice to keep the homestead happy- do your part. Clean up after yourself. Make dinner on occasion. 
I especially like to go out of my way to clean up if he‚Äôs had a rough day at work. I also like to make sure he‚Äôs got his own person space if he needs it. I ask him if he wants to come to bed with me. I never try to over obsess over anything. He‚Äôs got a bad habit of not picking his clothes up and refuses to do laundry or fold any of it. I ask him if he will help me fold to get it done faster. 
There will be things that drive you insane, but don‚Äôt be immature about it. Talk about it.

My parents weren‚Äôt strict but made sure we had our responsibilities. And I only had a phone because I walked to school. My parents didn‚Äôt want me consumed by technology and had me enjoy childhood. 
Come home from school, do homework, have a snack if I wanted, do chores, then we had an hour or two to go outside, play on the computer, talk on the phone, etc. dinner. Shower time. Turn in my phone to ensure I was going to get a full nights sleep. Be in bed by 9 pm.

I‚Äôve been on lamictal for almost three months. I started with 25mg, and went up to half 100 mg twice a day, now I‚Äôm directed to take the whole 100mg once a day. I have an appointment with my primary care coming up next week so my dose just might need to be upped. The last week or so on the 25mg I felt down again and felt like it wasn‚Äôt working so idk if it‚Äôs because of my Mirena or if my dose just needs to be upped. She said she wanted to see me at 250mg. She said she notices a difference in people once they hit the 250mg. The first few weeks I take it are great. But I feel myself becoming more irritable and hitting a difficult depressive episode which mania follows shortly after for me.

I‚Äôve never had children myself but I got an iud (Mirena) two days ago and I was told horror stories about the pain. I‚Äôve always experienced sickening/debilitating cramps while menstruating and that was nothing compared to iud insertion. I nearly passed out. My blood pressure dropped. I got hot and light headed.. on top of my anxiety being 10/10. After I came out my fianc√© asked me if I was okay because of how pale I was. 
The whole day after insertion I was bed ridden and nauseous. Totally useless. I was in so much pain I couldn‚Äôt even try to sleep it off.
